Install PIP

# 

<span key="29c21332377a4612a01338034d53206e"><span offset-key="29c21332377a4612a01338034d53206e:0">Getting Started</span></span>

<span key="1f49454aedb74c0b808a0bffb72917ce"><span offset-key="1f49454aedb74c0b808a0bffb72917ce:0">To get started with using pip, you should </span></span><a href="https://realpython.com/installing-python/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="53170eaf9f3b47eeaca18ed81249cdcb" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-3040_262-3041-240__"><span data-key="115adc6395394575976d6d5adcfeb31e"><span data-offset-key="115adc6395394575976d6d5adcfeb31e:0">install Python</span></span></span></a><span key="d0508d030bcb4c6793ac50ea283ca549"><span offset-key="d0508d030bcb4c6793ac50ea283ca549:0"> on your system.</span></span>

## 

<span key="e8dff96d14984f678d52d70c742295fa"><span offset-key="e8dff96d14984f678d52d70c742295fa:0">Ensure you have a working pip</span></span>

<span key="893255e53fcd42e695464f4b1b98958c"><span offset-key="893255e53fcd42e695464f4b1b98958c:0">As a first step, you should check that you have a working Python with pip installed. This can be done by running the following commands and making sure that the output looks similar.</span></span>

<span key="453b81201e394d698d4a1445af4386f3"><span offset-key="453b81201e394d698d4a1445af4386f3:0">Linux</span></span>

1

<span key="8d476ace971047d5b93db6cfd74e46ce"><span offset-key="8d476ace971047d5b93db6cfd74e46ce:0">$ python --version</span></span>

2

<span key="6942844145054a55889afbfb2541d926"><span offset-key="6942844145054a55889afbfb2541d926:0">Python 3.N.N</span></span>

3

<span key="c58cb5cb3a204a62b56bb88afa339a75"><span offset-key="c58cb5cb3a204a62b56bb88afa339a75:0">$ python -m pip --version</span></span>

4

<span key="88090442370d4d2eac178fae219a2179"><span offset-key="88090442370d4d2eac178fae219a2179:0">pip X.Y.Z from ... (python 3.N.N)</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7" />

Copied!

<span key="b439ad2658734314965729d1198ea26a"><span offset-key="b439ad2658734314965729d1198ea26a:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><span slate-void="true" key="1e290a314a3f4db3b552711246e8d9fb"></span>

<img src="https://pip.pypa.io/en/stable/_static/copy-button.svg" class="css-9pa8cd" draggable="false" />

<span key="e170dbdcb88245d4936631b8c2e5eda0"><span offset-key="e170dbdcb88245d4936631b8c2e5eda0:0">MacOSWindows</span></span>

<span key="0694161234da493695d59f58ffcb3181"><span offset-key="0694161234da493695d59f58ffcb3181:0">If that worked, congratulations! You have a working pip in your environment.</span></span>

<span key="e44557aa781f468fbfd3908e337847fc"><span offset-key="e44557aa781f468fbfd3908e337847fc:0">If you got output that does not look like the sample above, please read the </span></span><a href="https://pip.pypa.io/en/stable/installation/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="0338acbc53bd43c3bb1099238240a86c" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-3040_262-3041-240__"><span data-key="9a3aea94af404433ace3b26db064970e"><span data-offset-key="9a3aea94af404433ace3b26db064970e:0">Installation</span></span></span></a><span key="b609864aa39d450aa95dfd33ffa7b325"><span offset-key="b609864aa39d450aa95dfd33ffa7b325:0"> page. It provides guidance on how to install pip within a Python environment that doesn’t have it.</span></span>

## 

<span key="5e5b8159316e4c08a5da8acebe1ef488"><span offset-key="5e5b8159316e4c08a5da8acebe1ef488:0">Common tasks</span></span>

### 

<span key="56db565867474b0287de7346249bf0ae"><span offset-key="56db565867474b0287de7346249bf0ae:0">Install a package</span></span>

1

<span key="fee0d15b79dd47bcbb8b07f71680b204"><span offset-key="fee0d15b79dd47bcbb8b07f71680b204:0">$ python -m pip install sampleproject</span></span>

2

<span key="f6f98f6544c749cc90059d5b919116f7"><span offset-key="f6f98f6544c749cc90059d5b919116f7:0">MacOSWindows</span></span>

<span key="dc7114c5db8b411fadcdff629d95c33d"><span offset-key="dc7114c5db8b411fadcdff629d95c33d:0">By default, pip will fetch packages from </span></span><a href="https://pypi.org" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="c50915bf37de4f7c86e03ca73770e3ad" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-3040_262-3041-240__"><span data-key="f4cfe50b8f774e469c521604ecd2a27b"><span data-offset-key="f4cfe50b8f774e469c521604ecd2a27b:0">Python Package Index</span></span></span></a><span key="c55d73c5abcd437a9b21add1dbb9a83d"><span offset-key="c55d73c5abcd437a9b21add1dbb9a83d:0">, a repository of software for the Python programming language where anyone can upload packages.</span></span>

### 

<span key="a9f767d944a54499af1a2c798bf7a7b4"><span offset-key="a9f767d944a54499af1a2c798bf7a7b4:0">Install a package from GitHub</span></span>

<span key="9dea59fea87441cd8ae7d5f3fb269095"><span offset-key="9dea59fea87441cd8ae7d5f3fb269095:0">Linux</span></span>

1

<span key="219690be342f47d080fde39b9bfc5df1"><span offset-key="219690be342f47d080fde39b9bfc5df1:0">$ python -m pip install git+https://github.com/pypa/<a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" class="__cf_email__">[email protected]</a></span></span>

2

### 

<span key="679623d9ed7b49c3a59ccf69f616bcfd"><span offset-key="679623d9ed7b49c3a59ccf69f616bcfd:0">Install a package from a distribution file</span></span>

<span key="ff3e5129253a423c85c0349a96892c88"><span offset-key="ff3e5129253a423c85c0349a96892c88:0">pip can install directly from distribution files as well. They come in 2 forms:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="e5501aa4b57f45ee9c385b49300b58a9"><span offset-key="e5501aa4b57f45ee9c385b49300b58a9:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://packaging.python.org/glossary/#term-Source-Distribution-or-sdist" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="5c999245a9ee4e78a323e9f3fa4ad2f6" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-3040_262-3041-240__"><span data-key="97f3ed3bcda04b998037cb3a1b5f47ac"><span data-offset-key="97f3ed3bcda04b998037cb3a1b5f47ac:0">source distribution</span></span></span></a><span key="8b1dd5b845df44fe9f73df6165883a15"><span offset-key="8b1dd5b845df44fe9f73df6165883a15:0"> (usually shortened to “sdist”)</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="45cb2eb4bf974e2299643596f42ad33b"><span offset-key="45cb2eb4bf974e2299643596f42ad33b:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://packaging.python.org/glossary/#term-Wheel" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="db8628a238b3489ea4c4c3820db6e36b" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-3040_262-3041-240__"><span data-key="9d027ede5d9e41a69bb3466ca9d90764"><span data-offset-key="9d027ede5d9e41a69bb3466ca9d90764:0">wheel distribution</span></span></span></a><span key="b789043d2bb848a582cb0b002f2597ca"><span offset-key="b789043d2bb848a582cb0b002f2597ca:0"> (usually shortened to “wheel”)</span></span>

<span key="9329fb7c5a0742988252984f9ffca7d6"><span offset-key="9329fb7c5a0742988252984f9ffca7d6:0">Linux</span></span>

1

<span key="f2ed8903c441405d97e8f4cc916e2d7e"><span offset-key="f2ed8903c441405d97e8f4cc916e2d7e:0">$ python -m pip install sampleproject-1.0.tar.gz</span></span>

2

<span key="ae0a4dfdacd1466f839b27e89e22f467"><span offset-key="ae0a4dfdacd1466f839b27e89e22f467:0">\[...\]</span></span>

3

<span key="4ad98d60ef03435ca7bed8eff8c985b3"><span offset-key="4ad98d60ef03435ca7bed8eff8c985b3:0">Successfully installed sampleproject</span></span>

4

<span key="899c3ef6613146c4aed202182a362a1d"><span offset-key="899c3ef6613146c4aed202182a362a1d:0">$ python -m pip install sampleproject-1.0-py3-none-any.whl</span></span>

### 

<span key="c4188bb435784523ae1e63a167f7d5f1"><span offset-key="c4188bb435784523ae1e63a167f7d5f1:0">Install multiple packages using a requirements file</span></span>

<span key="6dff8f2c9c3841f3898746035ee7571b"><span offset-key="6dff8f2c9c3841f3898746035ee7571b:0">Many Python projects use </span>`requirements.txt`<span offset-key="6dff8f2c9c3841f3898746035ee7571b:2"> files, to specify the list of packages that need to be installed for the project to run. To install the packages listed in that file, you can run:</span></span>

<span key="29bb040e3cb64cb9a8868b37c514af8a"><span offset-key="29bb040e3cb64cb9a8868b37c514af8a:0">Linux</span></span>

1

<span key="fe48c14b8a904d918417c6962c166cc4"><span offset-key="fe48c14b8a904d918417c6962c166cc4:0">$ python -m pip install -r requirements.txt</span></span>

<span key="dcf5ff2939704fc780681c0bd09d27f0"><span offset-key="dcf5ff2939704fc780681c0bd09d27f0:0">Uninstall a package</span></span>

<span key="5e9917d62907420eaf4c4353265bd5a2"><span offset-key="5e9917d62907420eaf4c4353265bd5a2:0"> \[...\]</span></span>

4

<span key="4ef22078841843f89783855595c3818b"><span offset-key="4ef22078841843f89783855595c3818b:0">Proceed (y/n)? y</span></span>

5

<span key="e12a2eaefec04dcdabb4a2f628706723"><span offset-key="e12a2eaefec04dcdabb4a2f628706723:0">Successfully uninstalled sampleproject</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="f2ae757ff49a4c52b20b916e6daf550f"><span offset-key="f2ae757ff49a4c52b20b916e6daf550f:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><span slate-void="true" key="9633ab82f5d34451b186109819392215"></span>

## 

<span key="74b61ac028af4a8f97c9c7e66eb9ab9e"><span offset-key="74b61ac028af4a8f97c9c7e66eb9ab9e:0">Next Steps</span></span>

<span key="1eaae6a5ebb34df9acd9054b325e47c0"><span offset-key="1eaae6a5ebb34df9acd9054b325e47c0:0">It is recommended to learn about what virtual environments are and how to use them. <span key="372212c31e374823a4938a3db09ba7ce"><span offset-key="372212c31e374823a4938a3db09ba7ce:0">Install Python</span></span>

## 

<span key="30cf017dafbd46e8a1ef830b1a8fa99c"><span offset-key="30cf017dafbd46e8a1ef830b1a8fa99c:0">How to Install Python on Windows</span></span>

<span key="9e4780696d5b49c1b9f059222851ba83"><span offset-key="9e4780696d5b49c1b9f059222851ba83:0">There are three installation methods on Windows:</span></span>

1.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">1.</span>
    <span key="f40526bb4d144c2285524b9816e28e9e"><span offset-key="f40526bb4d144c2285524b9816e28e9e:0">The Microsoft Store</span></span>

2.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">2.</span>
    <span key="aaa990c2feb245f699b48700ad421f1f"><span offset-key="aaa990c2feb245f699b48700ad421f1f:0">The full installer</span></span>

3.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">3.</span>
    <span key="79ee7c5606a54a09972945a75d205677"><span offset-key="79ee7c5606a54a09972945a75d205677:0">Windows Subsystem for Linux</span></span>

<span key="62a0d5785b6647ceb512c62cdda6f71e"><span offset-key="62a0d5785b6647ceb512c62cdda6f71e:0">In this section, you’ll learn how to check which version of Python, if any, is installed on your Windows computer. You’ll also learn which of the three installation methods you should use.</span></span>

<span key="9698fed41e2c41c592b937a6dfc74eca"><span offset-key="9698fed41e2c41c592b937a6dfc74eca:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://srv.realpython.net/click/6931855635/?c=50660871541&amp;p=58946116052&amp;r=34494" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="ba6fae44f2884f52bd5e2bbb03497151" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-3040_262-3041-240__"><span data-key="5961f94ea015425c806ae4677a1b54ce"><span data-offset-key="5961f94ea015425c806ae4677a1b54ce:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><span data-slate-void="true" data-key="627c29f3fc514a38aab36baa63cfa5d0"><span></span></span></span></a>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1rasi3h r-1vzi8xi" />

<span key="b62fa8d894724e128880a562c0c13d77"><span offset-key="b62fa8d894724e128880a562c0c13d77:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><span key="eebfbc36ea4b4bd0bbf5be4c90d61c3f"><span offset-key="eebfbc36ea4b4bd0bbf5be4c90d61c3f:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://realpython.com/account/join/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="6e06939e5f5d41088e582a854fd6fab4" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-3040_262-3041-240__"><span data-key="65cb4f1862634414abb55cfe35d921f9"><span data-offset-key="65cb4f1862634414abb55cfe35d921f9:0"> Remove ads</span></span></span></a><span key="2bff6fcf743c4052ab547c282d76436c"><span offset-key="2bff6fcf743c4052ab547c282d76436c:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

### 

<span key="8bf3e847f9494a70a4cf7c27d802c3e0"><span offset-key="8bf3e847f9494a70a4cf7c27d802c3e0:0">How to Check Your Python Version on Windows</span></span>

<span key="7e8f721bc7b04367aec23b1ae992cc5f"><span offset-key="7e8f721bc7b04367aec23b1ae992cc5f:0">To check if you already have Python on your Windows machine, first open a command-line application, such as PowerShell.</span></span>

<span key="a2b75b73d27045f6be61ad3013b1b5f6">**Tip:**<span offset-key="a2b75b73d27045f6be61ad3013b1b5f6:1"> Here’s how you open PowerShell:</span></span>

1.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">1.</span>
    <span key="fb9d0c623779447498cd317c85769a5d"><span offset-key="fb9d0c623779447498cd317c85769a5d:0">Press the Win key.</span></span>

2.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">2.</span>
    <span key="9ce64312e647428a9f663c21db2d58af"><span offset-key="9ce64312e647428a9f663c21db2d58af:0">Type </span>`PowerShell`<span offset-key="9ce64312e647428a9f663c21db2d58af:2">.</span></span>

3.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">3.</span>
    <span key="a0bd858f67e14992a95f4344d7805817"><span offset-key="a0bd858f67e14992a95f4344d7805817:0">Press Enter.</span></span>

<span key="f3047218bd624a2e9806a7edcf71ea49"><span offset-key="f3047218bd624a2e9806a7edcf71ea49:0">Alternatively, you can right-click the </span>*Start*<span offset-key="f3047218bd624a2e9806a7edcf71ea49:2"> button and select </span>*Windows PowerShell*<span offset-key="f3047218bd624a2e9806a7edcf71ea49:4"> or </span>*Windows PowerShell (Admin)*<span offset-key="f3047218bd624a2e9806a7edcf71ea49:6">.</span></span>

<span key="a49c9c199919407a9c68ace42ba5b439"><span offset-key="a49c9c199919407a9c68ace42ba5b439:0">You can also use </span>`cmd.exe`<span offset-key="a49c9c199919407a9c68ace42ba5b439:2"> or </span></span><a href="https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/p/windows-terminal/9n0dx20hk701?activetab=pivot:overviewtab" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="5d739ec01217493781ab6b9d8cf6e51d" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-3040_262-3041-240__"><span data-key="e4ab857e9a614b0e879c0e8f4d7bdac2"><span data-offset-key="e4ab857e9a614b0e879c0e8f4d7bdac2:0">Windows Terminal</span></span></span></a><span key="1076d50deb4243b890d9c63be949a58d"><span offset-key="1076d50deb4243b890d9c63be949a58d:0">.</span></span>

<span key="120a86b6fc614b84ba72056e00878344"><span offset-key="120a86b6fc614b84ba72056e00878344:0">With the command line open, type in the following command and press Enter:</span></span>

1

<span key="f05808b561e84bd58ea33a687fcc69ef"><span offset-key="f05808b561e84bd58ea33a687fcc69ef:0">C:\\&gt; python --version</span></span>

2

<span key="c6426532b2364911843920c090cd06a1"><span offset-key="c6426532b2364911843920c090cd06a1:0">Python 3.8.4</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="3f9109fa7a5940efa465a81fb0f2c974"><span offset-key="3f9109fa7a5940efa465a81fb0f2c974:0">Using the </span>`--version`<span offset-key="3f9109fa7a5940efa465a81fb0f2c974:2"> switch will show you the version that’s installed. Alternatively, you can use the </span>`-V`<span offset-key="3f9109fa7a5940efa465a81fb0f2c974:4"> switch:</span></span>

1

<span key="6ec848d1e465470796ec66561c23fd43"><span offset-key="6ec848d1e465470796ec66561c23fd43:0">C:\\&gt; python -V</span></span>

2

<span key="bd8fa9adf6c44fbc93caa9f63912f4b3"><span offset-key="bd8fa9adf6c44fbc93caa9f63912f4b3:0">Python 3.8.4</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="800fd8749f874f12b4b62f87872ec3be"><span offset-key="800fd8749f874f12b4b62f87872ec3be:0">In either case, if you see a version less than </span>`3.8.4`<span offset-key="800fd8749f874f12b4b62f87872ec3be:2">, which was the most recent version at the time of writing, then you’ll want to upgrade your installation.</span></span>

<span key="703e32aaf43a4c54bef28a63598fa735">**Note:**<span offset-key="703e32aaf43a4c54bef28a63598fa735:1"> If you don’t have a version of Python on your system, then both of the above commands will launch the Microsoft Store and redirect you to the Python application page. You’ll see how to complete the installation from the Microsoft Store in the next section.</span></span>

<span key="1c877eec278846f8a3dbeac2e4f6c389"><span offset-key="1c877eec278846f8a3dbeac2e4f6c389:0">If you’re interested in where the installation is located, then you can use the </span>`where.exe`<span offset-key="1c877eec278846f8a3dbeac2e4f6c389:2"> command in </span>`cmd.exe`<span offset-key="1c877eec278846f8a3dbeac2e4f6c389:4"> or PowerShell:</span></span>

1

<span key="eab262df65fe475493db36dc6f2ca463"><span offset-key="eab262df65fe475493db36dc6f2ca463:0">C:\\&gt; where.exe python</span></span>

2

<span key="90578b3b160b4e11af60ceca9360e14b"><span offset-key="90578b3b160b4e11af60ceca9360e14b:0">C:\\Users\\mertz\\AppData\\Local\\Programs\\Python\\Python37-32\\python.exe</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="7bd31bb501474610ae2f1e629567a6db"><span offset-key="7bd31bb501474610ae2f1e629567a6db:0">Note that the </span>`where.exe`<span offset-key="7bd31bb501474610ae2f1e629567a6db:2"> command will work only if Python has been installed for your user account.</span></span>

### 

<span key="d7037abf8efc4d0a8e920479c2a3b808"><span offset-key="d7037abf8efc4d0a8e920479c2a3b808:0">What Your Options Are</span></span>

<span key="ddd40987004a46f78a13334ea81d02b2"><span offset-key="ddd40987004a46f78a13334ea81d02b2:0">As mentioned earlier, there are three ways to install the official Python distribution on Windows:</span></span>

1.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">1.</span>
    <span key="7b654e9f50f944d3a588b70d52734d26">**Microsoft Store package:**<span offset-key="7b654e9f50f944d3a588b70d52734d26:1"> The most straightforward installation method on Windows involves installing from the Microsoft Store app. This is recommended for beginner Python users looking for an easy-to-set-up interactive experience.</span></span>

2.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">2.</span>
    <span key="417202b480934048b8afa1870bf9b228">**Full Installer:**<span offset-key="417202b480934048b8afa1870bf9b228:1"> This approach involves downloading Python directly from the </span></span><a href="https://www.python.org" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="ce407dd4ce624921b5a41933ae2165b5" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-3040_262-3041-240__"><span data-key="c52915aac3464954a62dc0b9457cd574"><span data-offset-key="c52915aac3464954a62dc0b9457cd574:0">Python.org website</span></span></span></a><span key="4920876615a24566a341e3d8f1e03a6e"><span offset-key="4920876615a24566a341e3d8f1e03a6e:0">. This is recommended for intermediate and advanced developers who need more control during the setup process.</span></span>

3.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">3.</span>
    <span key="ff9a63b54b3d4fd9a8b23e76b4bf0c6d">**Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL):**<span offset-key="ff9a63b54b3d4fd9a8b23e76b4bf0c6d:1"> The WSL allows you to run a Linux environment directly in Windows. You can learn how to enable the WSL by reading the </span></span><a href="https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/wsl/install-win10" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="1cbf7968e48b4d6b96e837aebe23d58a" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-3040_262-3041-240__"><span data-key="642a0cb4496046a1b40c0f850d2d0ddb"><span data-offset-key="642a0cb4496046a1b40c0f850d2d0ddb:0">Windows Subsystem for Linux Installation Guide for Windows 10</span></span></span></a><span key="c2540cf73fab44e49372adea4dd3b3f7"><span offset-key="c2540cf73fab44e49372adea4dd3b3f7:0">.</span></span>

<span key="1af27f13688047778a34c378b4cacfb3"><span offset-key="1af27f13688047778a34c378b4cacfb3:0">In this section, we’ll focus on only the first two options, which are the most popular installation methods in a Windows environment.</span></span>

<span key="9d43a0c10ef14b93b66522b9bb954a03"><span offset-key="9d43a0c10ef14b93b66522b9bb954a03:0">If you want to install in the WSL, then you can read the </span></span><a href="https://realpython.com/installing-python/#how-to-install-python-on-linux" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="7d7cd01ea13c406f824356d549309088" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-3040_262-3041-240__"><span data-key="76843200c636448498f5799c4ed0e7b1"><span data-offset-key="76843200c636448498f5799c4ed0e7b1:0">Linux section</span></span></span></a><span key="b783e20dbebc4332bb582fd582d5d688"><span offset-key="b783e20dbebc4332bb582fd582d5d688:0"> of this tutorial after you’ve installed the Linux distribution of your choice.</span></span>

<span key="5b40ba85d61a496487d2695836a7e5d4">**Note:**<span offset-key="5b40ba85d61a496487d2695836a7e5d4:1"> You can also complete the installation on Windows using alternative distributions, such as </span></span><a href="https://www.anaconda.com" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="37079527be3d4115a3c0ddc24bfa6720" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-3040_262-3041-240__"><span data-key="9f984b2301ce41378965843eaf51ee82"><span data-offset-key="9f984b2301ce41378965843eaf51ee82:0">Anaconda</span></span></span></a><span key="f9de5a4dd97e4c789fed0930af4ab517"><span offset-key="f9de5a4dd97e4c789fed0930af4ab517:0">, but this tutorial covers only official distributions.</span></span>

<span key="9fc86e337cbb4406af0cf2762d93eb8e"><span offset-key="9fc86e337cbb4406af0cf2762d93eb8e:0">Anaconda is a popular platform for doing scientific computing and data science with Python. To learn how to install Anaconda on Windows, check out </span></span><a href="https://realpython.com/python-windows-machine-learning-setup/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="981397eaae97437aa965d2f58222a98a" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-3040_262-3041-240__"><span data-key="5782094081c34b4bb9560bc85f237180"><span data-offset-key="5782094081c34b4bb9560bc85f237180:0">Setting Up Python for Machine Learning on Windows</span></span></span></a><span key="f1e2077b173847ca9842e590a918eae8"><span offset-key="f1e2077b173847ca9842e590a918eae8:0">.</span></span>

<span key="1a4f0fdc7f6d4b1187219c2b13cf7c25"><span offset-key="1a4f0fdc7f6d4b1187219c2b13cf7c25:0">The two official Python installers for Windows aren’t identical. The Microsoft Store package has some important limitations.</span></span>

<span key="4739f9990c894a6485b66525925f3d20">**Limitations of the Microsoft Store Package**</span>

<span key="524d6de92b774b99a9a6fa71873c1cc5"><span offset-key="524d6de92b774b99a9a6fa71873c1cc5:0">The official Python documentation has this to say about the Microsoft Store package:</span></span>

> <span key="f1ec0f5da4364325b12d27cdfe8a63df"><span offset-key="f1ec0f5da4364325b12d27cdfe8a63df:0">The Microsoft Store package is an easily installable Python interpreter that is intended mainly for interactive use, for example, by students. (</span></span><a href="https://docs.python.org/3/using/windows.html#the-microsoft-store-package" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="a6283ca6c9584f2a9e25c6819eda34c9" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-3040_262-3041-240__"><span data-key="4147167721504036a8eb6b5d35919211"><span data-offset-key="4147167721504036a8eb6b5d35919211:0">Source</span></span></span></a><span key="ea517aa76bc84165b0b6ee0a19bcfc19"><span offset-key="ea517aa76bc84165b0b6ee0a19bcfc19:0">)</span></span>

<span key="3f829156d1b44e6c9b14131dbdb45147"><span offset-key="3f829156d1b44e6c9b14131dbdb45147:0">The key takeaway here is that the Microsoft Store package is “intended mainly for interactive use.” That is, the Microsoft Store package is designed to be used by students and people learning to use Python for the first time.</span></span>

<span key="3acdc93586994389b0bd06f24f458cd3"><span offset-key="3acdc93586994389b0bd06f24f458cd3:0">In addition to targeting beginning Pythonistas, the Microsoft Store package has limitations that make it ill-suited for a professional development environment. In particular, it </span></span><a href="https://docs.python.org/3/using/windows.html#known-issues" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="67cc515cee844e9f9e22bbc838ad711d" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-3040_262-3041-240__"><span data-key="121f02bfc3e04400a9ea725349b09f59"><span data-offset-key="121f02bfc3e04400a9ea725349b09f59:0">does not have full write access to shared locations</span></span></span></a><span key="c049cb1e6e2d414f9e33560565308d16"><span offset-key="c049cb1e6e2d414f9e33560565308d16:0"> such as </span>`TEMP`<span offset-key="c049cb1e6e2d414f9e33560565308d16:2"> or the registry.</span></span>

<span key="0710b6b5dac04429936a3890a5871637">**Windows Installer Recommendations**</span>

<span key="e43c6ad12d1642558ee680740ab10138"><span offset-key="e43c6ad12d1642558ee680740ab10138:0">If you’re new to Python and focused primarily on learning the language rather than building professional software, then you should install from the Microsoft Store package. This offers the shortest and easiest path to getting started with minimal hassle.</span></span>

<span key="80967aa7adf64ae4be45d66e6191575e"><span offset-key="80967aa7adf64ae4be45d66e6191575e:0">On the other hand, if you’re an experienced developer looking to develop professional software in a Windows environment, then the official Python.org installer is the right choice. Your installation won’t be limited by Microsoft Store policies, and you can control where the executable is installed and even add Python to </span>`PATH`<span offset-key="80967aa7adf64ae4be45d66e6191575e:2"> if necessary.</span></span>

<span key="8e55d605bade47749aaa9ded2cb41b85"><span offset-key="8e55d605bade47749aaa9ded2cb41b85:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://srv.realpython.net/click/36956403387/?c=50370534298&amp;p=58946116052&amp;r=85306" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="8b3ee733b70d49f1b434c86a812ff132" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-3040_262-3041-240__"><span data-key="6802e5a0a2b14cdd94ebdc20676250e5"><span data-offset-key="6802e5a0a2b14cdd94ebdc20676250e5:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><span data-slate-void="true" data-key="9a6f328dada84fff8b74030f3dc38644"><span></span></span></span></a>

### 

<span key="5fd7bcbd71874c3bad0eb9bd31ef798a"><span offset-key="5fd7bcbd71874c3bad0eb9bd31ef798a:0">How to Install From the Microsoft Store</span></span>

<span key="ee18aaea30874087a5804776e1b22404"><span offset-key="ee18aaea30874087a5804776e1b22404:0">If you’re new to Python and looking to get started quickly, then the Microsoft Store package is the best way to get up and running without any fuss. You can install from the Microsoft Store in two steps.</span></span>

<span key="3736803bdbf94cd7a05feeef8dd8f8a0">**Step 1: Open the Python App Page in the Microsoft Store**</span>

<span key="f9f8f113328b408e96c86409506ae846"><span offset-key="f9f8f113328b408e96c86409506ae846:0">Open the Microsoft Store app and search for </span>`Python`<span offset-key="f9f8f113328b408e96c86409506ae846:2">.</span></span>

<span key="12d146193195406e965c9622b26b5716"><span offset-key="12d146193195406e965c9622b26b5716:0">You’ll likely see multiple versions that you can choose to install:</span></span>

<span key="5ac0eb042b79477d90adb01348195ece"><span offset-key="5ac0eb042b79477d90adb01348195ece:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://files.realpython.com/media/Screen_Shot_2020-07-16_at_11.06.17_AM.4b41c401c5aa.png" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="fcea2a8beb504be3a06c99ff73162a74" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-3040_262-3041-240__"><span data-key="af4c1a2fad434f0fbb72093b3842221d"><span data-offset-key="af4c1a2fad434f0fbb72093b3842221d:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><span data-slate-void="true" data-key="f97f5d32157b4ea6806b1db845c49b63"><span></span></span></span></a>

<img src="https://files.realpython.com/media/Screen_Shot_2020-07-16_at_11.06.17_AM.4b41c401c5aa.png" class="css-9pa8cd" draggable="false" />

<span key="d437d792132e40bbb9a1c166e39bc47b"><span offset-key="d437d792132e40bbb9a1c166e39bc47b:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><span key="21c6117b68db41e483d41e7c14ad663e"><span offset-key="21c6117b68db41e483d41e7c14ad663e:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

<span key="2bbaac5e0c344b04bb103857f3d461c0"><span offset-key="2bbaac5e0c344b04bb103857f3d461c0:0">Select </span>*Python 3.8*<span offset-key="2bbaac5e0c344b04bb103857f3d461c0:2">, or the highest version number you see available in the app, to open the installation page.</span></span>

<span key="263d3416489448a9bf509f39050c6cb1">**Warning:**<span offset-key="263d3416489448a9bf509f39050c6cb1:1"> Make sure that the Python application you’ve selected is created by the </span>**Python Software Foundation**<span offset-key="263d3416489448a9bf509f39050c6cb1:3">.</span></span>

<span key="7d215cb0836345e89eeaff6c9eb434ab"><span offset-key="7d215cb0836345e89eeaff6c9eb434ab:0">The official Microsoft Store package will always be free, so if the application costs money, then it’s the </span>**wrong**<span offset-key="7d215cb0836345e89eeaff6c9eb434ab:2"> application.</span></span>

<span key="769c0c76c75a4f99b97fdff9d3c61b29"><span offset-key="769c0c76c75a4f99b97fdff9d3c61b29:0">Alternatively, you can open PowerShell and type the following command:</span></span>

1

<span key="1804dfdb7e5f4fea95ea17803a2dd116"><span offset-key="1804dfdb7e5f4fea95ea17803a2dd116:0">C:\\&gt; python</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="de556f18692f4ced97e1d38467007264"><span offset-key="de556f18692f4ced97e1d38467007264:0">If you don’t already have a version of Python on your system, then when you press Enter, the Microsoft Store will automatically launch and take you to the latest version of Python in the store.</span></span>

<span key="add54c98e7ea4eb088546afbac334313">**Step 2: Install the Python App**</span>

<span key="20c943f0e15a48a6beda7d52e0d70822"><span offset-key="20c943f0e15a48a6beda7d52e0d70822:0">After you’ve selected the version to be installed, follow these steps to complete the installation:</span></span>

1.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">1.</span>
    <span key="d1577fce47bc413499fce6590300f779"><span offset-key="d1577fce47bc413499fce6590300f779:0">Click </span>*Get*<span offset-key="d1577fce47bc413499fce6590300f779:2">.</span></span>

2.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">2.</span>
    <span key="1b9549410c704cd284a611511dd54858"><span offset-key="1b9549410c704cd284a611511dd54858:0">Wait for the application to download. When it’s finished downloading, the </span>*Get*<span offset-key="1b9549410c704cd284a611511dd54858:2"> button will be replaced with a button that says </span>*Install on my devices*<span offset-key="1b9549410c704cd284a611511dd54858:4">.</span></span>

3.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">3.</span>
    <span key="16149bfac09a44dd876ffd25a48deba7"><span offset-key="16149bfac09a44dd876ffd25a48deba7:0">Click </span>*Install on my devices*<span offset-key="16149bfac09a44dd876ffd25a48deba7:2"> and select the devices on which you’d like to complete the installation.</span></span>

4.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">4.</span>
    <span key="878334f6da514a26ad85cb215295cb5e"><span offset-key="878334f6da514a26ad85cb215295cb5e:0">Click </span>*Install Now*<span offset-key="878334f6da514a26ad85cb215295cb5e:2"> and then </span>*OK*<span offset-key="878334f6da514a26ad85cb215295cb5e:4"> to start the installation.</span></span>

5.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">5.</span>
    <span key="c0c08e372bd3497b9c2a740fa69746ef"><span offset-key="c0c08e372bd3497b9c2a740fa69746ef:0">If the installation was successful, then you’ll see the message “This product is installed” at the top of the Microsoft Store page.</span></span>

<span key="610b1ebb03b749b0be2bff02eaa6b50d"><span offset-key="610b1ebb03b749b0be2bff02eaa6b50d:0">Congratulations! You now have access to Python, including </span></span><a href="https://realpython.com/what-is-pip/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="a58520537e284b41956815f7baac4977" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-3040_262-3041-240__"><span data-key="811a35d5634a4fee9c918b1307e499f5"><code class="r-1vckr1u r-z2wwpe r-uibjmv r-m2pi6t r-1hvjb8t" data-slate-leaf="true" data-offset-key="811a35d5634a4fee9c918b1307e499f5:0">pip</code></span></span></a><span key="350df5ca80f6427db9d383c23b062fb6"><span offset-key="350df5ca80f6427db9d383c23b062fb6:0"> and </span></span><a href="https://realpython.com/python-idle/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="d350adfa895f41e89fa038b4815facac" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-3040_262-3041-240__"><span data-key="62ad7588e41a4f9c90b5860da949af4e"><span data-offset-key="62ad7588e41a4f9c90b5860da949af4e:0">IDLE</span></span></span></a><span key="408bb2465dc3410b87f02e01bacfd746"><span offset-key="408bb2465dc3410b87f02e01bacfd746:0">!</span></span>

### 

<span key="7b1564ad02bd47ec85752b3f916e0683"><span offset-key="7b1564ad02bd47ec85752b3f916e0683:0">How to Install From the Full Installer</span></span>

<span key="29956f2a358d426db52022b65e50e44b"><span offset-key="29956f2a358d426db52022b65e50e44b:0">For professional developers who need a full-featured Python development environment, installing from the full installer is the right choice. It offers more customization and control over the installation than installing from the Microsoft Store.</span></span>

<span key="96751ea45d2d4727bcd2a5bb97606327"><span offset-key="96751ea45d2d4727bcd2a5bb97606327:0">You can install from the full installer in two steps.</span></span>

<span key="88fd31a6340248d191aaf0d02e1fbc5f">**Step 1: Download the Full Installer**</span>

<span key="db644020263e42029527e282a8b29669"><span offset-key="db644020263e42029527e282a8b29669:0">Follow these steps to download the full installer:</span></span>

1.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">1.</span>
    <span key="344f72fa6d91495696b029c4f6b1386e"><span offset-key="344f72fa6d91495696b029c4f6b1386e:0">Open a browser window and navigate to the Python.org </span></span><a href="https://www.python.org/downloads/windows/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="04623963e2eb488ebe8ab1d68c0ec2eb" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-3040_262-3041-240__"><span data-key="63c330c877774eb6a4e904400be8b3c3"><span data-offset-key="63c330c877774eb6a4e904400be8b3c3:0">Downloads page for Windows</span></span></span></a><span key="53e96ce18dea48118035c1990297ac9c"><span offset-key="53e96ce18dea48118035c1990297ac9c:0">.</span></span>

2.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">2.</span>
    <span key="9a19cfe431064b749059c2a75d2ffe73"><span offset-key="9a19cfe431064b749059c2a75d2ffe73:0">Under the “Python Releases for Windows” heading, click the link for the </span>*Latest Python 3 Release - Python 3.x.x*<span offset-key="9a19cfe431064b749059c2a75d2ffe73:2">. As of this writing, the latest version was Python 3.8.4.</span></span>

3.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">3.</span>
    <span key="2665c4351a1149df9772e9e2b99e1202"><span offset-key="2665c4351a1149df9772e9e2b99e1202:0">Scroll to the bottom and select either </span>*Windows x86-64 executable installer for 64-bit*<span offset-key="2665c4351a1149df9772e9e2b99e1202:2"> or </span>*Windows x86 executable installer for 32-bit*<span offset-key="2665c4351a1149df9772e9e2b99e1202:4">.</span></span>

<span key="917bf7173a654950b17a2162c5fe69f8"><span offset-key="917bf7173a654950b17a2162c5fe69f8:0">If you aren’t sure whether to select the 32-bit or the 64-bit installer, then you can expand the box below to help you decide.</span></span>

<span key="9557912afbb344878fc0781686c74272"><span offset-key="9557912afbb344878fc0781686c74272:0">32-bit or 64-bit Python?Show/Hide</span></span>

<span key="3feaf8d48b94455ba5dfae95890751f9"><span offset-key="3feaf8d48b94455ba5dfae95890751f9:0">When the installer is finished downloading, move on to the next step.</span></span>

<span key="93a1ca962af14b399d2fbdf61cf3631a">**Step 2: Run the Installer**</span>

<span key="43fd56846d8b49619c6ff323ae00f412"><span offset-key="43fd56846d8b49619c6ff323ae00f412:0">Once you’ve chosen and downloaded an installer, run it by double-clicking on the downloaded file. A dialog box like the one below will appear:</span></span>

<span key="b7fa04c386754416b3e3544365e48ae0"><span offset-key="b7fa04c386754416b3e3544365e48ae0:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://files.realpython.com/media/Screen_Shot_2020-07-16_at_11.19.15_AM.6e62bfc6eede.png" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="8a5b002a792e4b6d8b2827f8ca95de2e" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-3040_262-3041-240__"><span data-key="ab4d6538f475401483c20c0ca8917264"><span data-offset-key="ab4d6538f475401483c20c0ca8917264:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><span data-slate-void="true" data-key="9d612634181f451180b6f41a2bc6df58"><span></span></span></span></a>

<img src="https://files.realpython.com/media/Screen_Shot_2020-07-16_at_11.19.15_AM.6e62bfc6eede.png" class="css-9pa8cd" draggable="false" />

<span key="dd7eb94637aa4687ab5b17dcb71b542f"><span offset-key="dd7eb94637aa4687ab5b17dcb71b542f:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><span key="f90b301ffe2c4e45804ef9357e130eca"><span offset-key="f90b301ffe2c4e45804ef9357e130eca:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

<span key="a46359f57b7e4652884f13770054be4a"><span offset-key="a46359f57b7e4652884f13770054be4a:0">There are four things to notice about this dialog box:</span></span>

1.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">1.</span>
    <span key="5d0889530eb84f5ba4ec3459f0b66252"><span offset-key="5d0889530eb84f5ba4ec3459f0b66252:0">The default install path is in the </span></span><a href="https://superuser.com/questions/656003/why-is-python-for-windows-not-installed-in-programfiles-c-program-files" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="75ae247f2c384684852dbd98af5ce086" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-3040_262-3041-240__"><span data-key="ab7f1a42c9004fcbbc3969e4eb9bedbb"><code class="r-1vckr1u r-z2wwpe r-uibjmv r-m2pi6t r-1hvjb8t" data-slate-leaf="true" data-offset-key="ab7f1a42c9004fcbbc3969e4eb9bedbb:0">AppData/</code><span data-offset-key="ab7f1a42c9004fcbbc3969e4eb9bedbb:1"> directory</span></span></span></a><span key="4e0df894b1104e2ebb731a2709cc2b6e"><span offset-key="4e0df894b1104e2ebb731a2709cc2b6e:0"> of the current Windows user.</span></span>

2.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">2.</span>
    <span key="a5b3daa975d04f4b95401dcb97d9b561"><span offset-key="a5b3daa975d04f4b95401dcb97d9b561:0">The </span>*Customize installation*<span offset-key="a5b3daa975d04f4b95401dcb97d9b561:2"> button can be used to customize the installation location and which additional features get installed, including </span>`pip`<span offset-key="a5b3daa975d04f4b95401dcb97d9b561:4"> and IDLE.</span></span>

3.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">3.</span>
    <span key="de71b6ed581b4c43920e130673e22a41"><span offset-key="de71b6ed581b4c43920e130673e22a41:0">The </span>*Install launcher for all users (recommended)*<span offset-key="de71b6ed581b4c43920e130673e22a41:2"> checkbox is checked default. This means every user on the machine will have access to the </span></span><a href="https://docs.python.org/3/using/windows.html#launcher" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="71b21aabf8e84e03924116e076eda719" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-3040_262-3041-240__"><span data-key="b2a95242279a46ed9d12179057556924"><code class="r-1vckr1u r-z2wwpe r-uibjmv r-m2pi6t r-1hvjb8t" data-slate-leaf="true" data-offset-key="b2a95242279a46ed9d12179057556924:0">py.exe</code><span data-offset-key="b2a95242279a46ed9d12179057556924:1"> launcher</span></span></span></a><span key="d9acd6955b06456189998455b78077ce"><span offset-key="d9acd6955b06456189998455b78077ce:0">. You can uncheck this box to restrict Python to the current Windows user.</span></span>

4.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">4.</span>
    <span key="c2bc443ba4024e1bbc8c56f85ced6f7f"><span offset-key="c2bc443ba4024e1bbc8c56f85ced6f7f:0">The </span>*Add Python 3.8 to* `PATH`<span offset-key="c2bc443ba4024e1bbc8c56f85ced6f7f:3"> checkbox is unchecked by default. There are </span></span><a href="https://discuss.python.org/t/could-we-add-python-to-system-path-by-default/3067" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="e00e42c53c19403da3e0acb7ad06c77f" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-3040_262-3041-240__"><span data-key="5a24302310c54da3b38267ae2280e7c9"><span data-offset-key="5a24302310c54da3b38267ae2280e7c9:0">several reasons</span></span></span></a><span key="8b99edfda31e4c84b4bc57bfdf087d5f"><span offset-key="8b99edfda31e4c84b4bc57bfdf087d5f:0"> that you might not want Python on </span>`PATH`<span offset-key="8b99edfda31e4c84b4bc57bfdf087d5f:2">, so make sure you understand the implications before you check this box.</span></span>

<span key="b9a54fe409e248cb8c2049844b792081"><span offset-key="b9a54fe409e248cb8c2049844b792081:0">The full installer gives you total control over the installation process.</span></span>

<span key="31caa33a2e09443c95f23dba9da46bd4">**Warning:**<span offset-key="31caa33a2e09443c95f23dba9da46bd4:1"> If you don’t know what </span>`PATH`<span offset-key="31caa33a2e09443c95f23dba9da46bd4:3"> is, then it’s highly recommended that you </span>**do not**<span offset-key="31caa33a2e09443c95f23dba9da46bd4:5"> install with the full installer. Use the </span></span><a href="https://realpython.com/installing-python/#how-to-install-from-the-microsoft-store" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="c3a5ad4b76b04de6b9299f0ef7b9b619" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-3040_262-3041-240__"><span data-key="d688f879286b42aba3079c7a20c9133c"><span data-offset-key="d688f879286b42aba3079c7a20c9133c:0">Microsoft Store package</span></span></span></a><span key="3ae06d08194b49a680535c374a8e3572"><span offset-key="3ae06d08194b49a680535c374a8e3572:0"> instead.</span></span>

<span key="f7a225b0f16d4ed6a5afc7d19c523dae"><span offset-key="f7a225b0f16d4ed6a5afc7d19c523dae:0">Customize the installation to meet your needs using the options available on the dialog box. Then click </span>*Install Now*<span offset-key="f7a225b0f16d4ed6a5afc7d19c523dae:2">. That’s all there is to it!</span></span>

<span key="32e219a1d0e645e1aa06e8613fa9bcd2"><span offset-key="32e219a1d0e645e1aa06e8613fa9bcd2:0">Congratulations—you now have the latest version of Python 3 on your Windows machine!</span></span>

<span key="f6546c55c65944998e5ab7dd46bb3117"><span offset-key="f6546c55c65944998e5ab7dd46bb3117:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://srv.realpython.net/click/32768813333/?c=50370534298&amp;p=58946116052&amp;r=13304" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="6652ba5c19934510a101a2c2c4fa818c" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-3040_262-3041-240__"><span data-key="76e3f117bb5248db84ef7c91879f67a6"><span data-offset-key="76e3f117bb5248db84ef7c91879f67a6:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><span data-slate-void="true" data-key="7124a21d89514958960102dcfc481ecf"><span></span></span></span></a>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1rasi3h r-1vzi8xi" />

<span key="a1d48e700cb446e8aedadb60b122715c"><span offset-key="a1d48e700cb446e8aedadb60b122715c:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><span key="42898a1d5da94ff6a6297ec4c16d1ee9"><span offset-key="42898a1d5da94ff6a6297ec4c16d1ee9:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://realpython.com/account/join/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="6c40503f336d4b86a6e4cae14b8c5349" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-3040_262-3041-240__"><span data-key="2b6519c4cf334ea3a757be193fae5e44"><span data-offset-key="2b6519c4cf334ea3a757be193fae5e44:0"> Remove ads</span></span></span></a><span key="434167d6cc284461b63f1fec3618495e"><span offset-key="434167d6cc284461b63f1fec3618495e:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

## 

<span key="3dabc72cce0042039ec16d246dcfa709"><span offset-key="3dabc72cce0042039ec16d246dcfa709:0">How to Install Python on macOS</span></span>

<span key="2e41819651a14322900057a8135ee6a2"><span offset-key="2e41819651a14322900057a8135ee6a2:0">Python 2 comes preinstalled on older versions of macOS. This is no longer the case for current versions of macOS, </span></span><a href="https://developer.apple.com/documentation/macos-release-notes/macos-catalina-10_15-release-notes#Scripting-Language-Runtimes" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="e2cf277ad02b4f6b91bcbc5b2a685ca3" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-3040_262-3041-240__"><span data-key="af40904a9df44bb3892ab9bfc13b3ffe"><span data-offset-key="af40904a9df44bb3892ab9bfc13b3ffe:0">starting with macOS Catalina</span></span></span></a><span key="964e197c01bf44c08ca6fbdab59aa460"><span offset-key="964e197c01bf44c08ca6fbdab59aa460:0">.</span></span>

<span key="0fe2387d98c24c5c90ee2eb0f85918a0"><span offset-key="0fe2387d98c24c5c90ee2eb0f85918a0:0">There are two installation methods on macOS:</span></span>

1.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">1.</span>
    <span key="fdd25ed6a7d243dcbda15063da6deca8"><span offset-key="fdd25ed6a7d243dcbda15063da6deca8:0">The official installer</span></span>

2.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">2.</span>
    <span key="f793699f709043a7b099015a12e8bad9"><span offset-key="f793699f709043a7b099015a12e8bad9:0">The Homebrew package manager</span></span>

<span key="a99f5cc2ea1c4f53b687012800013d02"><span offset-key="a99f5cc2ea1c4f53b687012800013d02:0">In this section, you’ll learn how to check which version of Python, if any, is installed on your macOS device. You’ll also learn which of the two installation methods you should use.</span></span>

### 

<span key="eb6e640227f34a2cbc942a38579cb789"><span offset-key="eb6e640227f34a2cbc942a38579cb789:0">How to Check Your Python Version on a Mac</span></span>

<span key="6683c10446f1434bab731dfeb5cb0f78"><span offset-key="6683c10446f1434bab731dfeb5cb0f78:0">To check which Python version you have on your Mac, first open a command-line application, such as Terminal.</span></span>

<span key="2c57267a14584cf3baf538785b78660f">**Tip:**<span offset-key="2c57267a14584cf3baf538785b78660f:1"> Here’s how you open Terminal:</span></span>

1.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">1.</span>
    <span key="ddd06d834358471e8e9509ab9d05bf7f"><span offset-key="ddd06d834358471e8e9509ab9d05bf7f:0">Press the Cmd+Space keys.</span></span>

2.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">2.</span>
    <span key="be91204db4964ef8821913f1e5eae19c"><span offset-key="be91204db4964ef8821913f1e5eae19c:0">Type </span>`Terminal`<span offset-key="be91204db4964ef8821913f1e5eae19c:2">.</span></span>

3.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">3.</span>
    <span key="f5bca1b712664fe39c923e66119ec2e4"><span offset-key="f5bca1b712664fe39c923e66119ec2e4:0">Press Enter.</span></span>

<span key="2cd2f4cb621f43849ef44638d8cfa0e2"><span offset-key="2cd2f4cb621f43849ef44638d8cfa0e2:0">Alternatively, you can open Finder and navigate to </span>*Applications → Utilities → Terminal*<span offset-key="2cd2f4cb621f43849ef44638d8cfa0e2:2">.</span></span>

<span key="2243640ab33c43228e726bfbd11390a7"><span offset-key="2243640ab33c43228e726bfbd11390a7:0">With the command line open, type in the following commands:</span></span>

1

<span key="832dba01b983409a9751c93049bc0e5b"><span offset-key="832dba01b983409a9751c93049bc0e5b:0"># Check the system Python version</span></span>

2

<span key="dbeb6a22e2304da09ede2da6a204a283"><span offset-key="dbeb6a22e2304da09ede2da6a204a283:0">$ python --version</span></span>

3

<span key="ab5220d72d3b407daf02f69d958439d3"><span offset-key="ab5220d72d3b407daf02f69d958439d3:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

4

<span key="a3feef6166294e17a6c0454508449f7d"><span offset-key="a3feef6166294e17a6c0454508449f7d:0"># Check the Python 2 version</span></span>

5

<span key="9f2bd27e17894fa79743a23c4981123c"><span offset-key="9f2bd27e17894fa79743a23c4981123c:0">$ python2 --version</span></span>

6

<span key="c60f890bf8e942ef93150f170689acab"><span offset-key="c60f890bf8e942ef93150f170689acab:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

7

<span key="e2d1d0c570a04a53954048a30f8763a9"><span offset-key="e2d1d0c570a04a53954048a30f8763a9:0"># Check the Python 3 version</span></span>

8

<span key="122e41abd37941239a0b5fa736947165"><span offset-key="122e41abd37941239a0b5fa736947165:0">$ python3 --version</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="ada2005dfc0642b0a1d530243bb0738f"><span offset-key="ada2005dfc0642b0a1d530243bb0738f:0">If you have Python on your system, then one or more of these commands should respond with a version number.</span></span>

<span key="247dfaf1c8cb45628dfa3fcc0a691f0e"><span offset-key="247dfaf1c8cb45628dfa3fcc0a691f0e:0">For example, if Python 3.6.10 were already set up on your computer, then the </span>`python3`<span offset-key="247dfaf1c8cb45628dfa3fcc0a691f0e:2"> command would display that version number:</span></span>

1

<span key="64c36a8f721246d791746bb99b0ba164"><span offset-key="64c36a8f721246d791746bb99b0ba164:0">$ python3 --version</span></span>

2

<span key="31eb004d15ea4342badd6b27777f5740"><span offset-key="31eb004d15ea4342badd6b27777f5740:0">Python 3.6.10</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="cb02fe5d51114714b2c8206d097d28d9"><span offset-key="cb02fe5d51114714b2c8206d097d28d9:0">You’ll want to get the latest version of Python if any of these conditions is true:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="cf381d9ecd8741e090992b92df312068"><span offset-key="cf381d9ecd8741e090992b92df312068:0">None of the above commands returns a version number.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="b9bcb8be20e34bc297fe92196710d5e7"><span offset-key="b9bcb8be20e34bc297fe92196710d5e7:0">The only version you see displayed is in the Python 2.X series.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="ba7a9e495ca34109837adc5101f85b60"><span offset-key="ba7a9e495ca34109837adc5101f85b60:0">You have a version of Python 3 that isn’t the latest available, which was version 3.8.4 as of this writing.</span></span>

### 

<span key="1a9e0f6f9696480a903bcc262d458776"><span offset-key="1a9e0f6f9696480a903bcc262d458776:0">What Your Options Are</span></span>

<span key="7ee2414c76354569914c96f7782cd561"><span offset-key="7ee2414c76354569914c96f7782cd561:0">There are two ways to install the official Python distribution on macOS:</span></span>

1.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">1.</span>
    <span key="c1c04b0d91f54a9886a105e5740c9752">**The official installer:**<span offset-key="c1c04b0d91f54a9886a105e5740c9752:1"> This method involves downloading the official installer from the Python.org website and running it on your machine.</span></span>

2.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">2.</span>
    <span key="5cf94a67b0744055afee49e2d871cdd0">**The Homebrew package manager:**<span offset-key="5cf94a67b0744055afee49e2d871cdd0:1"> This method involves downloading and installing </span></span><a href="https://brew.sh" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="f67341c22ab446a8a21a531df8a2a30c" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-3040_262-3041-240__"><span data-key="2fd4931a0e21447a9f211a1d2e941db7"><span data-offset-key="2fd4931a0e21447a9f211a1d2e941db7:0">the Homebrew package manager</span></span></span></a><span key="f80785fe8c21461bb6b58174727b19f2"><span offset-key="f80785fe8c21461bb6b58174727b19f2:0"> if you don’t already have it installed, and then typing a command into a terminal application.</span></span>

<span key="1b1600e7c3c44e8680ae3e71fc0f853a"><span offset-key="1b1600e7c3c44e8680ae3e71fc0f853a:0">Both the official installer and the Homebrew package manager will work, but only the official installer is maintained by the Python Software Foundation.</span></span>

<span key="a00a3e705e6448b1931148e0b3a19953">**Note:**<span offset-key="a00a3e705e6448b1931148e0b3a19953:1"> You can also complete the installation on macOS using alternative distributions, such as </span></span><a href="https://www.anaconda.com" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="cf0df677a1b749db97be81a9d8ef0458" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-3040_262-3041-240__"><span data-key="9960d2e1d9ac4d69813f68e10f2943fd"><span data-offset-key="9960d2e1d9ac4d69813f68e10f2943fd:0">Anaconda</span></span></span></a><span key="a418d132ae4b472291cbb5cb6b10f002"><span offset-key="a418d132ae4b472291cbb5cb6b10f002:0">, but this tutorial covers only official distributions.</span></span>

<span key="19137f0808304703b15189b181e26256"><span offset-key="19137f0808304703b15189b181e26256:0">Anaconda is a popular platform for doing scientific computing and data science with Python. To learn how to install Anaconda on macOS, check out the </span></span><a href="https://docs.anaconda.com/anaconda/install/mac-os/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="378775e80739454fb8e7f768dab900d5" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-3040_262-3041-240__"><span data-key="faa6419d130c4195b5535436051ff29e"><span data-offset-key="faa6419d130c4195b5535436051ff29e:0">macOS installation guide</span></span></span></a><span key="60c9d9bb5875476bbfa497e5bc3992e0"><span offset-key="60c9d9bb5875476bbfa497e5bc3992e0:0"> from the official Anaconda documentation.</span></span>

<span key="4ceb3629d5794f349976c4721c92d4c3"><span offset-key="4ceb3629d5794f349976c4721c92d4c3:0">The distributions installed by the official installer and the Homebrew package manager aren’t identical. Installing from Homebrew has some limitations.</span></span>

<span key="34bd37a32da24d749bbd4d69608f7fa1">**Limitations of Installing From Homebrew**</span>

<span key="1466204d0012417999f9980d62ab2a7f"><span offset-key="1466204d0012417999f9980d62ab2a7f:0">The Python distribution for macOS available on Homebrew </span></span><a href="https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-core/pull/34424" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="ecbbab03cf484f2aa145092a8e87a2b8" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-3040_262-3041-240__"><span data-key="8b69f787a14649959d624e8e5e724468"><span data-offset-key="8b69f787a14649959d624e8e5e724468:0">doesn’t include the Tcl/Tk dependency</span></span></span></a><span key="f5cb94cded30439296bbb45cc59842a7"><span offset-key="f5cb94cded30439296bbb45cc59842a7:0"> required by the Tkinter module. Tkinter is the standard library module for developing </span></span><a href="https://realpython.com/python-gui-tkinter/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="7e25f37600c34110b06923c24acfd094" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-3040_262-3041-240__"><span data-key="11b42a76264b45fdbc8c598742bd1af3"><span data-offset-key="11b42a76264b45fdbc8c598742bd1af3:0">graphical user interfaces in Python</span></span></span></a><span key="20c1705279094ece89fc13d2202e7b51"><span offset-key="20c1705279094ece89fc13d2202e7b51:0"> and is in fact an interface for the </span></span><a href="https://www.tcl.tk" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="8e17f565760e4af8ab1b23aad2101786" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-3040_262-3041-240__"><span data-key="f4f0c4ed780e4a14a18b38033c1385c8"><span data-offset-key="f4f0c4ed780e4a14a18b38033c1385c8:0">Tk GUI toolkit</span></span></span></a><span key="cde6b5f8c03c49408c108c98bf80aabe"><span offset-key="cde6b5f8c03c49408c108c98bf80aabe:0">, which isn’t part of Python.</span></span>

<span key="e4c5d5353f0d4fb9b3247cae7c45c115"><span offset-key="e4c5d5353f0d4fb9b3247cae7c45c115:0">Homebrew doesn’t install the Tk GUI toolkit dependency. Instead, it relies on an existing version installed on your system. The system version of Tcl/Tk may be outdated or missing entirely and could prevent you from importing the Tkinter module.</span></span>

<span key="4f835762770d497591c35cd04fb03234">**macOS Installer Recommendations**</span>

<span key="b66deb5b338c430bafab4837839779de"><span offset-key="b66deb5b338c430bafab4837839779de:0">The Homebrew package manager is a popular method for installing Python on macOS because it’s easy to manage from the command line and offers commands to upgrade Python without having to go to a website. Because Homebrew is a command-line utility, it can be automated with bash scripts.</span></span>

<span key="068365055eda493c9946047c1382a8ab"><span offset-key="068365055eda493c9946047c1382a8ab:0">However, the Python distribution offered by Homebrew isn’t controlled by the Python Software Foundation and could change at any time. The most reliable method on macOS is to use the official installer, especially if you plan on doing </span></span><a href="https://realpython.com/python-gui-tkinter/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="71daa36808be483ea25053f1f4905c88" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-3040_262-3041-240__"><span data-key="d33d32e3c01f48a6a34e3bafaed51126"><span data-offset-key="d33d32e3c01f48a6a34e3bafaed51126:0">Python GUI programming with Tkinter</span></span></span></a><span key="bfe9b0e29d9e4e5f96ebdffc4714cfa1"><span offset-key="bfe9b0e29d9e4e5f96ebdffc4714cfa1:0">.</span></span>

<span key="d01c0fa4db7348a2bb31b626a1caa3d2"><span offset-key="d01c0fa4db7348a2bb31b626a1caa3d2:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://srv.realpython.net/click/30513864559/?c=62098619220&amp;p=58946116052&amp;r=59590" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="e74f6ac9be36437698a6134048b6bf39" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-3040_262-3041-240__"><span data-key="a892901be52c444b83578c66650fc3ea"><span data-offset-key="a892901be52c444b83578c66650fc3ea:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><span data-slate-void="true" data-key="5e9ee6879078466483163e0ee7bd7f85"><span></span></span></span></a>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1rasi3h r-1vzi8xi" />

<span key="5168529755c0479895c8ed9bcd150534"><span offset-key="5168529755c0479895c8ed9bcd150534:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><span key="7963bee3155448949b3da64208e08aeb"><span offset-key="7963bee3155448949b3da64208e08aeb:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://realpython.com/account/join/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="3720b6030c5b420cb9fe6f4b2eb45b85" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-3040_262-3041-240__"><span data-key="bd8a5bb140384e2ba81dbb056b13c8bc"><span data-offset-key="bd8a5bb140384e2ba81dbb056b13c8bc:0"> Remove ads</span></span></span></a><span key="dfe9a827c59a4feea7f91d8deca9962b"><span offset-key="dfe9a827c59a4feea7f91d8deca9962b:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

### 

<span key="76cafc4f0018467e99ce89055cf1f44d"><span offset-key="76cafc4f0018467e99ce89055cf1f44d:0">How to Install From the Official Installer</span></span>

<span key="25e48bb1b2d648df8b1c8c13e7139573"><span offset-key="25e48bb1b2d648df8b1c8c13e7139573:0">Installing Python from the official installer is the most reliable installation method on macOS. It includes all the system dependencies needed for developing applications with Python.</span></span>

<span key="a3ac8ebd1a324ee983e563221983c8b8"><span offset-key="a3ac8ebd1a324ee983e563221983c8b8:0">You can install from the official installer in two steps.</span></span>

<span key="cf8537065abe4be5896756773e106b87">**Step 1: Download the Official Installer**</span>

<span key="8d3b0910159a405c9fd144f26c7e0551"><span offset-key="8d3b0910159a405c9fd144f26c7e0551:0">Follow these steps to download the full installer:</span></span>

1.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">1.</span>
    <span key="25be6239a1cd49268a07a731041ddfef"><span offset-key="25be6239a1cd49268a07a731041ddfef:0">Open a browser window and navigate to the Python.org </span></span><a href="https://www.python.org/downloads/mac-osx/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="ee0e97d29f894463b875a33b33693d11" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-3040_262-3041-240__"><span data-key="168a2eb0f1c246d6b69c253a0f51671a"><span data-offset-key="168a2eb0f1c246d6b69c253a0f51671a:0">Downloads page for macOS</span></span></span></a><span key="fc89c94875fa4c81b4b26c671571af1f"><span offset-key="fc89c94875fa4c81b4b26c671571af1f:0">.</span></span>

2.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">2.</span>
    <span key="4e0ecf869dc74263bf92297aa2b3ac3a"><span offset-key="4e0ecf869dc74263bf92297aa2b3ac3a:0">Under the “Python Releases for Mac OS X” heading, click the link for the </span>*Latest Python 3 Release - Python 3.x.x*<span offset-key="4e0ecf869dc74263bf92297aa2b3ac3a:2">. As of this writing, the latest version was Python 3.8.4.</span></span>

3.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">3.</span>
    <span key="b52546c5dd4a4c87b11ce836801204d6"><span offset-key="b52546c5dd4a4c87b11ce836801204d6:0">Scroll to the bottom and click </span>*macOS 64-bit installer*<span offset-key="b52546c5dd4a4c87b11ce836801204d6:2"> to start the download.</span></span>

<span key="6750f8c48508403db456329608d07660"><span offset-key="6750f8c48508403db456329608d07660:0">When the installer is finished downloading, move on to the next step.</span></span>

<span key="802d06d033764389ac6242ecad842c6b">**Step 2: Run the Installer**</span>

<span key="fa8e97c179494d07afd314918917a5f6"><span offset-key="fa8e97c179494d07afd314918917a5f6:0">Run the installer by double-clicking the downloaded file. You should see the following window:</span></span>

<span key="1575e7b9584e4496a0995443aef2ea73"><span offset-key="1575e7b9584e4496a0995443aef2ea73:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://files.realpython.com/media/Screen_Shot_2020-07-15_at_8.31.24_AM.2e5b82dbc195.png" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="1efd84df499a43b98d0fe775492fae62" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-3040_262-3041-240__"><span data-key="0644b55ca6fd4808b8feea9081a162cf"><span data-offset-key="0644b55ca6fd4808b8feea9081a162cf:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><span data-slate-void="true" data-key="7100bf8d40bb4affa6d9fdf03e6321af"><span></span></span></span></a>

<img src="https://files.realpython.com/media/Screen_Shot_2020-07-15_at_8.31.24_AM.2e5b82dbc195.png" class="css-9pa8cd" draggable="false" />

<span key="7649c1b06827496d8080f7dd9bb9a3ce"><span offset-key="7649c1b06827496d8080f7dd9bb9a3ce:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><span key="5cc0ba5184ec4845aeb862bf060ccd5e"><span offset-key="5cc0ba5184ec4845aeb862bf060ccd5e:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

<span key="971e1e1a7e624a51be12a77ee8845560"><span offset-key="971e1e1a7e624a51be12a77ee8845560:0">Follow these steps to complete the installation:</span></span>

1.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">1.</span>
    <span key="462885dbba0347f6a606e44eb8c70a52"><span offset-key="462885dbba0347f6a606e44eb8c70a52:0">Press </span>*Continue*<span offset-key="462885dbba0347f6a606e44eb8c70a52:2"> a few times until you’re asked to agree to the software license agreement. Then click </span>*Agree*<span offset-key="462885dbba0347f6a606e44eb8c70a52:4">.</span></span>

2.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">2.</span>
    <span key="362833fc5580496398154c7806be9f26"><span offset-key="362833fc5580496398154c7806be9f26:0">You’ll be shown a window that tells you the install destination and how much space it will take. You most likely don’t want to change the default location, so go ahead and click </span>*Install*<span offset-key="362833fc5580496398154c7806be9f26:2"> to start the installation.</span></span>

3.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">3.</span>
    <span key="ef505d3db3004ea69eb113c32167e421"><span offset-key="ef505d3db3004ea69eb113c32167e421:0">When the installer is finished copying files, click </span>*Close*<span offset-key="ef505d3db3004ea69eb113c32167e421:2"> to close the installer window.</span></span>

<span key="60308aa3a330410481b0e28ff275b49a"><span offset-key="60308aa3a330410481b0e28ff275b49a:0">Congratulations—you now have the latest version of Python 3 on your macOS computer!</span></span>

### 

<span key="60d70d25589c4e99b1e6773ead5f58fd"><span offset-key="60d70d25589c4e99b1e6773ead5f58fd:0">How to Install From Homebrew</span></span>

<span key="eb0dec85650d4974902db7714740c986"><span offset-key="eb0dec85650d4974902db7714740c986:0">For users who need to install from the command line, especially those who won’t be using Python to develop graphical user interfaces with the Tkinter module, the Homebrew package manager is a good option. You can install from the Homebrew package manager in two steps.</span></span>

<span key="a7ff94e7dd574d5cbcc678f9c97effe4">**Step 1: Install Homebrew**</span>

<span key="af556e4d858242ecb58a4f5ead87fec0"><span offset-key="af556e4d858242ecb58a4f5ead87fec0:0">If you already have Homebrew installed, then you can skip this step. If you don’t have Homebrew installed, then use the following procedure to install Homebrew:</span></span>

1.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">1.</span>
    <span key="26932abe3a7e4276bf87c213a8cce568"><span offset-key="26932abe3a7e4276bf87c213a8cce568:0">Open a browser and navigate to </span></span><a href="http://brew.sh" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="1a8d06265a0b42e783cee86f4e07f31f" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-3040_262-3041-240__"><span data-key="f41ddb390e3a4cdd802313021bfaa140"><span data-offset-key="f41ddb390e3a4cdd802313021bfaa140:0">http://brew.sh/</span></span></span></a><span key="3e6c1a5c07b54b458e206d69c457ad8e"><span offset-key="3e6c1a5c07b54b458e206d69c457ad8e:0">.</span></span>

2.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">2.</span>
    <span key="e1af0ef273ec4c57a68fdf3728dd9b54"><span offset-key="e1af0ef273ec4c57a68fdf3728dd9b54:0">You should see a command for installing Homebrew near the top of the page under the tile “Install Homebrew.” This command will be something like the following:</span></span>

    1

    <span key="43ead0141e08435eaccabebf272a7dee"><span offset-key="43ead0141e08435eaccabebf272a7dee:0">$ /bin/bash -c "$(curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Homebrew/install/master/install.sh)"</span></span>

    <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

    Copied!

    <span key="76af678e6d8b4bf08130409eec969979"><span offset-key="76af678e6d8b4bf08130409eec969979:0">Highlight the command with your cursor and press Cmd+C to copy it to your clipboard.</span></span>

3.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">3.</span>
    <span key="4cf8674cd34b4161844cb59c22459616"><span offset-key="4cf8674cd34b4161844cb59c22459616:0">Open a terminal window and paste the command, then press Enter. This will begin the Homebrew installation.</span></span>

4.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">4.</span>
    <span key="ab3468ff47bf40ffbde8bbbf02d7083e"><span offset-key="ab3468ff47bf40ffbde8bbbf02d7083e:0">Enter your macOS user password when prompted.</span></span>

<span key="a09e19457f824905afb232db50afb93a"><span offset-key="a09e19457f824905afb232db50afb93a:0">Depending on your Internet connection, it may take a few minutes to download all of Homebrew’s required files. Once the installation is complete, you’ll end up back at the shell prompt in your terminal window.</span></span>

<span key="cb4d9f62ec864a88bb0d080b61725f72">**Note:**<span offset-key="cb4d9f62ec864a88bb0d080b61725f72:1"> If you’re doing this on a fresh install of macOS, you may get a pop-up alert asking you to </span>**install Apple’s command line developer tools.**<span offset-key="cb4d9f62ec864a88bb0d080b61725f72:3"> These tools are necessary for installation, so you can confirm the dialog box by clicking </span>*Install*<span offset-key="cb4d9f62ec864a88bb0d080b61725f72:5">.</span></span>

<span key="20afc498c58f40e98a236b431cd45939"><span offset-key="20afc498c58f40e98a236b431cd45939:0">After the developer tools are installed, you’ll need to press Enter to continue installation of Homebrew.</span></span>

<span key="506daa77e38e40e193ef37ffcc259cf3"><span offset-key="506daa77e38e40e193ef37ffcc259cf3:0">Now that Homebrew is installed, you’re ready to install Python.</span></span>

<span key="b7093e2e73254d529696b7613fa024a9">**Step 2: Install Python**</span>

<span key="e8f7d352cd13411dbc8696764dc75ea6"><span offset-key="e8f7d352cd13411dbc8696764dc75ea6:0">Follow these steps to complete the installation with Homebrew:</span></span>

1.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">1.</span>
    <span key="427f7ce58f114107b36a7b8e87526e5b"><span offset-key="427f7ce58f114107b36a7b8e87526e5b:0">Open a terminal application.</span></span>

2.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">2.</span>
    <span key="b4199f92e08341d78520f78209a172a0"><span offset-key="b4199f92e08341d78520f78209a172a0:0">Type in the following command to upgrade Homebrew:</span></span>

    1

    <span key="a0eab23dae94489286cab2f48353c0b6"><span offset-key="a0eab23dae94489286cab2f48353c0b6:0">$ brew update && brew upgrade</span></span>

    <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

    Copied!

<span key="885e199a1c9d4b4a82b1596d9d0b5095"><span offset-key="885e199a1c9d4b4a82b1596d9d0b5095:0">Installing with Homebrew is now as straightforward as running the command </span>`brew install python3`<span offset-key="885e199a1c9d4b4a82b1596d9d0b5095:2">. This will download and set up the latest version of Python on your machine.</span></span>

<span key="b9bd796f2bc54ba1a93fe691acce2dc6"><span offset-key="b9bd796f2bc54ba1a93fe691acce2dc6:0">You can make sure everything went correctly by testing if you can access Python from the terminal:</span></span>

1.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">1.</span>
    <span key="eef511d8ec454351884eb1dc5a933c89"><span offset-key="eef511d8ec454351884eb1dc5a933c89:0">Open a terminal.</span></span>

2.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">2.</span>
    <span key="d0ed07fd79f54eed96ecb77e9b9650bd"><span offset-key="d0ed07fd79f54eed96ecb77e9b9650bd:0">Type </span>`pip3`<span offset-key="d0ed07fd79f54eed96ecb77e9b9650bd:2"> and press Enter.</span></span>

3.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">3.</span>
    <span key="ec1c4b20441a4ab784e01e2d8b786ba1"><span offset-key="ec1c4b20441a4ab784e01e2d8b786ba1:0">You should see the help text from </span></span><a href="https://realpython.com/what-is-pip/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="c0fe3adcc29a43a6bd0292dbbf74c3bf" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-3040_262-3041-240__"><span data-key="841dbb3de2ad496a9c9162bbfa1ec0f0"><span data-offset-key="841dbb3de2ad496a9c9162bbfa1ec0f0:0">Python’s </span><code class="r-1vckr1u r-z2wwpe r-uibjmv r-m2pi6t r-1hvjb8t" data-slate-leaf="true" data-offset-key="841dbb3de2ad496a9c9162bbfa1ec0f0:1">pip</code><span data-offset-key="841dbb3de2ad496a9c9162bbfa1ec0f0:2"> package manager</span></span></span></a><span key="0de2486f991c4a76b390ce05f8b65ac6"><span offset-key="0de2486f991c4a76b390ce05f8b65ac6:0">. If you get an error message running </span>`pip3`<span offset-key="0de2486f991c4a76b390ce05f8b65ac6:2">, then go through the install steps again to make sure you have a working installation.</span></span>

<span key="6e9298afa0e34e01baabaf586915da23"><span offset-key="6e9298afa0e34e01baabaf586915da23:0">Congratulations—you now have Python on your macOS system!</span></span>

<span key="0ec1c888559d4bb0987f47d7e8640903"><span offset-key="0ec1c888559d4bb0987f47d7e8640903:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://srv.realpython.net/click/66325228902/?c=62098619220&amp;p=58946116052&amp;r=20963" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="5b41dd6f3cd341ef82d74611a3f917e1" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_260-3040_262-3041-240__"><span data-key="6971f3b2b59545b49e3a6e6bcd8ffafa"><span data-offset-key="6971f3b2b59545b49e3a6e6bcd8ffafa:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><span data-slate-void="true" data-key="da01cad2d7544ac1954e9b8c05a3a563"><span></span></span></span></a>
